It belongs to the family Sphenogyneae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and delicate, white or pale pink flowers. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments, typically in forest understories where it can receive indirect sunlight. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and limited distribution, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
